Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are given a set of tables: Orders, Order Lines, Delivery, Invoice, Payments, Products optional, Resources optional. The goal is to generate a comprehensive event log for process mining.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to derive events from each table: From Orders: Order Created with timestamp order_date, resource sales_person_id. From Order Lines: Item Picked for each line item with item_picking_date and picker_id. From Delivery: Order Dispatched and Order Arrived for each delivery record. From Invoice: Invoice Issued with invoice_issue_date. From Payments: Payment Received with payment_date.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Orders can have multiple line items, deliveries, invoices, payments, so create events for each to capture detail. Use order_id as Case ID. Map timestamps chronologically per order. Include resources by mapping IDs to names from Resources table.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: For Item Picked, create one event per line item since multiple picking dates. For payments, resource might be blank or N/A since no company actor specified. For missing data like order 1004 no delivery or invoice, only include available events.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: List events per order in chronological order: Order 1001 events from created to payment. Order 1002 with multiple deliveries and invoices. Order 1003 complete. Order 1004 only created and picked. Order 1005 complete. Verify timestamps increase per case.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Design event log table with columns: Case ID, Activity Name, Timestamp, Resource name role, customer_id, item_id, quantity, delivery_id, invoice_id, payment_id, Other Attributes for extras like customer_type, delivery_note, invoice_amount, payment_method.
